title: Marjorie Taylor Greene calls 3 GOP colleagues 'pro-pedophile'
summary: Georgia Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene accused Republican Senators Mitt Romney, Susan Collins, and Lisa Murkowski of being 'pro-pedophile' for their decision to vote in favor of President Biden's Supreme Court nominee, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson. Greene's accusations centered on claims that Jackson was lenient in sentencing child pornography offenders. The attack came after these senators supported a procedural motion to advance Jackson's nomination, despite this being a narrow vote. Greene's statements were criticized on social media, with critics labeling them as extreme and unfounded. Her comments hearken back to past conspiracy theories and have drawn condemnation from various corners, emphasizing divisions within the Republican Party. Greene, whose personal Twitter account was suspended for policy violations, continues to make controversial statements, maintaining her aggressive political style.
snippet: Marjorie Taylor Greene says GOP colleagues Romney, Collins and Murkowksi are 'pro-pedophile' for voting to confirm Ketanji Brown Jackson to SCOTUS because of her soft-on-crime child porn sentencing

title: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene Condemned For One Of Her Vilest ... - HuffPost
summary: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene faced significant backlash for a tweet from her congressional account accusing GOP Senators Lisa Murkowski, Susan Collins, and Mitt Romney of being 'pro-pedophile.' This accusation stemmed from their decision to vote in favor of confirming Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court, following misleading claims by GOP lawmakers that Jackson was lenient in cases involving child sexual abuse images. Critics on Twitter condemned Greene's accusations, with some attempting to report her tweet to Twitter. This incident adds to the controversy surrounding Greene, who has previously been removed from Twitter for repeated violations of the platform’s policies on coronavirus misinformation.
snippet: Greene used her congressional account to tweet the baseless accusation that GOP Sens. Lisa Murkowski (Alaska), Susan Collins (Maine) and Mitt Romney (Utah) are pro-pedophile because they said will vote to confirm Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene: Romney, Collins, and Murkowski are pro-pedophile
summary: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene accused Senators Mitt Romney, Susan Collins, and Lisa Murkowski of being 'pro-pedophile' after they supported the confirmation of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson. Her tweet was criticized as demagogic and conspiratorial, echoing themes associated with QAnon. The accusations align with a trend among some activists to demonize political opponents by labeling them as sympathizers of child molesters. This rhetoric has been highlighted by various individuals and commentators who argue that it shifts focus from genuine child protection to weaponizing children's safety for conservative political gains. Senator Mitt Romney defended his vote by stating he found Judge Jackson to be 'mainstream' and a highly qualified candidate, in response to previous insinuations from Senator Josh Hawley that Jackson was lenient on child abusers. The discourse around the use of 'groomer' as an insult has been described as dangerous, drawing comparisons to McCarthyism.
snippet: Murkowski, Collins, and Romney are pro-pedophile. They just voted for #KBJ. Its got it all. Its cartoonishly demagogic. Its combative  she fights!  to the point of outright smears. Its tribalistic, targeting Republicans who refuse to go along with crowd instead of focusing on the other party. Its conspiratorial ...

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Calls GOP Senators Supporting Brown ... - Newsweek
summary: Georgia U.S. Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene accused Republican Senators Susan Collins, Lisa Murkowski, and Mitt Romney of being 'pro-pedophile' for supporting the nomination of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court. Greene's charges were connected to debates over Jackson's sentencing practices in child pornography cases, claims that fact-checkers deemed misleading. Despite criticism and allegations from some Republicans during confirmation hearings, Collins, Murkowski, and Romney defended their decision to support Jackson, arguing for a non-politicized review process and highlighting Jackson's qualifications. If confirmed, Jackson would be the first Black woman to serve on the Supreme Court.
snippet: Georgia U.S. Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene has labeled three fellow Republicans who may vote to confirm Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's appointment to the Supreme Court as 'pro-pedophile ...

title: Who believes Romney, Collins, Murkowski are 'pro-pedophile' aside from ...
summary: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene has accused Republican Senators Mitt Romney, Lisa Murkowski, and Susan Collins of being 'pro-pedophile' because they supported the confirmation of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court. Greene's claims originated from false accusations led by Senators Ted Cruz and Josh Hawley, alleging Jackson was lenient on sex offenders. Greene has a history of using unfounded conspiracy theories, such as Pizzagate and QAnon, to attack political opponents as child predators. Despite Greene's accusations, several Republican leaders, including Ronna McDaniel and Senator Josh Hawley, have publicly refuted her claims, stating they do not believe these senators condone pedophilia. Senators Lindsey Graham and Mike Lee also dismissed Greene's statements as inappropriate and silly. Greene's comments have not received broad support from her party's leadership, and notable Republicans have largely remained silent on the issue.
snippet: You are either a Senator that supports child rapists, child pornography, and the most vile child predators, or not, she added. If theres any doubt she was accusing her fellow Republicans of...

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Calls Democrats 'Pedophiles' - Mediaite
summary: Marjorie Taylor Greene has recently escalated accusations against political opponents, particularly targeting Democrats with claims of being 'pro-pedophile.' This rhetoric aligns with her previous support of the QAnon conspiracy theory, which asserts that Democrats are part of a global pedophile ring. Greene has accused Republican Senators Lisa Murkowski, Susan Collins, and Mitt Romney of supporting pedophilia for backing Ketanji Brown Jackson's Supreme Court confirmation, despite debunked allegations against Jackson regarding leniency in child-pornography cases. Additionally, Greene condemned the Democratic Party, linking them to pedophilia through Disney's opposition to Florida's 'Don't Say Gay' law and the actions of certain teachers. She described the party as 'the party of pedophiles' and criticized their stance on gender and sexual orientation education. The smear campaign has extended beyond Greene, with right-wing figures like Mollie Hemingway also suggesting Romney's support for Jackson indicates sympathy with pedophiles.
snippet: On Monday, she leveled the deranged accusation that Republican Senators Lisa Murkowski, Susan Collins and Mitt Romney are pro-pedophile because they said they will support Ketanji Brown ...

title: MTG Says 3 GOP Senators Are 'Pro-Pedophile' for Jackson ... - Insider
summary: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene accused three GOP senators—Mitt Romney, Susan Collins, and Lisa Murkowski—of being 'pro-pedophile' for supporting Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson’s Supreme Court nomination. Greene’s comments echo a QAnon-influenced attack strategy seen during Jackson's confirmation hearings, where Sen. Josh Hawley criticized her sentencing record for child abuse image cases as lenient. Despite these accusations being condemned as misleading, Greene's remarks were interpreted as an indirect appeal to QAnon supporters, a conspiracy theory group alleging Democratic elites run a child-trafficking network. Greene has previously shown affiliations with QAnon rhetoric online.
snippet: Marjorie Taylor Greene said 3 GOP senators are 'pro-pedophile' for backing Ketanji Brown Jackson to join SCOTUS, recycling a QAnon smear. Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA). Greene attacked GOP ...

title: Why Republicans Romney, Murkowski, and Collins say they'll vote for ...
summary: Republican Senators Susan Collins, Lisa Murkowski, and Mitt Romney have decided to break from their party to vote for Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's confirmation to the Supreme Court, marking the historic elevation of the first Black woman to the court. The decision is seen as a political risk, and it remains unclear if they will face backlash. Collins was the first to declare support, followed by Murkowski and Romney. Murkowski appreciated Jackson's composure under intense scrutiny during hearings and criticized the overly politicized confirmation process. Romney, after initially voting against Jackson in a previous role, was convinced of her mainstream position and qualifications after personal meetings and review. Collins noted discrepancies with some of Jackson's sentencing but stated that disagreeing with every decision is not disqualifying. The senators expressed concerns about the increasingly politicized nature of Supreme Court confirmations undermining public confidence in the judiciary.
snippet: J. Scott Applewhite/AP. Three Republican senators -- Susan Collins of Maine, Lisa Murkowski of Alaska and Mitt Romney of Utah -- have taken the political risk of breaking from their party to vote ...

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene said 3 GOP senators are 'pro-pedophile' for ...
summary: Marjorie Taylor Greene accused three Republican senators of being 'pro-pedophile' for supporting the nomination of Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court. This accusation echoes a baseless QAnon conspiracy theory that Democratic elites are involved in child-trafficking. Greene's remarks followed GOP senators Mitt Romney, Susan Murkowski, and Susan Collins indicating their support for Jackson, assisting in advancing her nomination to a full Senate vote. Greene's comments were linked to GOP senator Josh Hawley's previous criticism of Jackson's sentencing record for child abuse image cases, which was denounced by legal experts as misleading. Green has previously been associated with QAnon slogans and conspiracy theories.
snippet: 'Murkowski, Collins, and Romney are pro-pedophile. They just voted for #KBJ' , tweeted Greene, a prominent member of the GOP's far right House faction whose political career has soared from stirring...
